description: The art for the Plant token created by Khalni Garden is incorrect
The triggered ability of [Apathy] causes a soft-lock.
When [Entreat the Angels] is on the stack with 0 chosen for X, the blue text that typically indicates the value of X does not appear.
[Rosheen Meanderer] is unable to contribute mana to spells that ask an opponent to pay X, such as [Condescend].
Split cards are unable to be cast through the Hideaway Lands from Lorwyn such as [Shelldock Isle]

If [Vesuva] copies a land with a static ability and then is later turned into a basic land (perhaps by a [Blood Moon] or [Spreading Seas]), that static ability will not be removed. Triggered and activated abilities are correctly removed.

If [Vesuva] copies a land with a static ability and then is later turned into a basic land (perhaps by a [Blood Moon] or [Spreading Seas]), that static ability will not be removed. Triggered and activated abilities are correctly removed.

If [Vesuva] copies a land with a static ability and then is later turned into a basic land (perhaps by a [Blood Moon] or [Spreading Seas]), that static ability will not be removed. Triggered and activated abilities are correctly removed.
Vampire tokens created by [Bloodline Keeper] have incorrect art and incorrectly display that they have lifelink.
When [Blood Moon] or [Magus of the Moon] is in play, you are incorrectly prompted to name creature types for lands that require you to name one as they enter the battlefield.
When [Blood Moon] or [Magus of the Moon] is in play, you are incorrectly prompted to name creature types for lands that require you to name one as they enter the battlefield.
The Scarab God and God-Pharaoh's Gift do not respect 706.9d and replaces characteristic defining abilities when creating copies of creatures.
The Scarab God and God-Pharaoh's Gift do not respect 706.9d and replaces characteristic defining abilities when creating copies of creatures.
The art for the token created by [Sound the Call] is incorrect.
[Thornbite Staff] doesn't display the equip cost line when zoomed in upon.
The art for the wolf token created by [Garruk, the Veil-Cursed] is incorrect.
[Samurai of the Pale Curtain] does not exile tokens.
[Shelldock Isle] and other hideaway lands from Lorwyn do not allow you to play lands.
[Shelldock Isle] and other hideaway lands from Lorwyn do not allow you to play lands.
[Shelldock Isle] and other hideaway lands from Lorwyn do not allow you to play lands.

[Ashiok, Nightmare Weaver] is unable to put a creature with converted mana cost equal to its current loyalty onto the battlefield.
If some (not all) of [Terastodon]'s targets are indestructible permanent(s), it will incorrectly create elephant token(s) for the owner of those permanents.

Kamigawa Flip cards such as [Stabwhisker the Odious] are displayed as enchantments and do not respect the Attack With All function or changes to power and toughness. Workaround: Click the creature separately to attack with it, and right click the creature to display its correct power and toughness.
[Austere Command] does not respect 711.4b and treats the converted mana cost of the back side of double-faced permanents as 0.
[Death's Shadow] can become larger than 13/13 and does not respect the recent rules change to 107.1b
If all of [Yisan, the Wanderer Bard]'s verse counters are removed in response to its ability, you are able to search your library for any creature, regardless of CMC.
All lands fetched using [Borderland Explorer]'s ETB ability, regardless of who owns it, will ends up in Borderland's controller hand, but those lands can't be played or discarded
[Knowledge Pool] With multiple Knowledge Pools in play, casting a spell from hand lets you cast a spell from each Pool.
[Orcish Spy] and cards with similar ability shows the cards in alphabetical order, not the actual order
Dredging rather than drawing can let you avoid discarding
Dredging rather than drawing can let you avoid discarding
[Volcano Hellion] Damage is capped at 255
Redirecting spells sometimes restarts the game in a buggy state
Redirecting spells sometimes restarts the game in a buggy state
Redirecting spells sometimes restarts the game in a buggy state
Redirecting spells sometimes restarts the game in a buggy state

When there are floating generic mana and restricted mana (such as [Mishra's Workshop] mana) that are same color (or same colorless), MTGO will always use generic mana first before using the restricted mana. Workaround: don't float the generic mana if you want to use the restricted mana first
Opponent is not given the option to scry card to the bottom when clashing
While on the stack, the triggered ability of Hanweir Garrison contains a text error that indicates an incorrect number of tokens to be added. This is a display issue only.
[Sheltering Ancient]'s Cumulative Upkeep Stops Working After One Age Counter
[Vexing Sphinx]'s Cumulative Upkeep Doesn't Make You Discard
[Archangel of Strife] War or Peace choice repeats indefinitely.
[Jodah's Avenger] Activated ability continues activating infinitely.
[Lurking Evil] makes you pay half your opponent's life total
Masticores do not require discard to stay in play
Masticores do not require discard to stay in play
Masticores do not require discard to stay in play
[Pack's Disdain] does not work
[Screams from Within]'s second ability (Return ~ to your hand) does not function.
[Abandoned Sarcophagus] Does not allow you to pick x when casting cycling cards from graveyard
If a player uses the Undo function when selecting cards for their opponent's [Gifts Ungiven], they will only be able to choose 1 card to go to the graveyard.
If [Phantom Tiger] dies in combat, blue text abilities it had been granted do not apply to that combat's damage.
If a player casts [Reflector Mage] targeting a creature they own, and then in the following turn their opponent casts Reflector Mage, they are able to immediately recast that creature.
[Words of Waste] does not function.
[The Ur-Dragon] also reduces its own casting cost.
[Kess Dissident Mage]'s ability allows you to cast spells during other players' turns and to cast spells with no mana costs
If [Vesuvan Shapeshifter] copies a Megamorph creature with it's face-up ability, it will retain the Megamorph ability in later turns, gaining +1/+1 counters.
Casting [Sylvan Primordial] causes the game to be soft-locked in a multiplayer game if there are no legal targets for one player.
If [Deceiver of Form]'s triggered ability turns creatures into copies of a legendary creature, the legend rule fails to apply to the copies.

The mana abilities of [Wall of Roots] and [Kozilek's Translator] cannot be activated while paying the mana cost of a spell or ability. Players can still activate these abilities at any time that player has priority.

The mana abilities of [Wall of Roots] and [Kozilek's Translator] cannot be activated while paying the mana cost of a spell or ability. Players can still activate these abilities at any time that player has priority.
[Harsh Mentor]'s triggered ability also affects abilities activated from creatures in the graveyard.
The Keybindings for 'Yes' and 'No' do not function correctly with Shocklands such as [Steam Vents].
[Death Pit Offering] sacrifices all of its owner’s permanents, not just creatures
If you target an [Icefall Regent] with a fused split card, you must pay {2} for each side of the split card, for a total of {4}
[Ricochet Trap] restarts the game when cast for its alternate cost.
If you cast Savage Stomp with [Gonti, Lord of Luxury] and your opponent controls a dinosaur, the cost will incorrectly be reduced by 2.
[Doubling Season] incorrectly doubles loyalty counters added from costs of loyalty abilities.
Certain cards, such as [Hada Freeblade], do not display a legality error for the Pauper format in the collection scene.
There are known issues with giving flashback to a spell that is put on the bottom of a library as it resolves.
There are known issues with giving flashback to a spell that is put on the bottom of a library as it resolves.
There are known issues with giving flashback to a spell that is put on the bottom of a library as it resolves.
There are known issues with giving flashback to a spell that is put on the bottom of a library as it resolves.
[Gishath, Sun's Avatar] does not allow you to decline to put a Dinosaur creature into play if you have one in your hand.
[Collected Company] does not allow you to put fewer than the maximum number of creatures onto the battlefield.
[Commandeer] does not gain control of the targeted noncreature spell.
[Rimescale Dragon] does not place an Ice Counter on targeted creatures.
[Settle the Wreckage] does not give the targeted player the option to not search their library.
[Axis of Mortality] still fully resolves when a player cannot gain life.
If [Unesh, Criosphinx Sovereign] or similar creatures have their creature type changed, they do not trigger.
As Foretold incorrectly does not apply to cards able to be cast due to [Abandoned Sarcophagus].
[Goblin Game] reveals your chosen number before your opponents choose.
Hollow One's cost reduction doesn't consider split cards that are discarded
Creatures returned with [Puppeteer Clique] are exiled at the end of any turn, not just the controller's
Using [Oriss, Samite Guardian]'s Grandeur ability during controller's precombat main phase will not allow controller to attack that turn.
If Containment Priest and [Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite] are both Exhumed, Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite is exiled and her effect lasts indefinitely.
The undo function works incorrectly with [Torment of Hailfire].
[Tomorrow, Azami's Familiar] puts both cards back on top
[Booby Trap] does not let you name anything other than non-basic lands.
Creatures that, when they've become the target of a spell of a spell or ability andcopy it for each other creature can sometime cause the game to restart after resolution of the spell and its copies.
Creatures that, when they've become the target of a spell of a spell or ability andcopy it for each other creature can sometime cause the game to restart after resolution of the spell and its copies.
[Compost] If a player cast a split card that are black on the uncasted side, the draw effect isn't triggered
[Liquid Fire] doesn't let you choose how to deal damage - it all goes to player
[Misdirection] can reset the game in rare cases.
[Vizier of Many Faces] keeps its abilities when an opponent controls Overwhelming Splendor.
[Gideon, Martial Paragon] AKH Planeswalker deck has 1 Gideon's Intervention instead of 1 Glory-Bound Initiate.
If a commander is chosen for [Riches] in Rags // Riches, no other opponents need to choose a creature.
If [Trueheart Duelist] blocks multiple attackers, as well as another creature as part of a group, damage assignment errors can arise.
[Sunscourge Champion] will cause you to lose life if it has negative power when its trigger resolves.
[Multani's Presence] incorrectly draws cards off copies of spells that are countered
[Freyalise's Winds] Permanents with wind counters remove counters instead of untapping at any time, not only during their controller's untap step.
[Chandra Nalaar] Ultimate ability (Chandra's -8) does not count as damage from a planeswalker.
[Cursed Scroll] does not deal damage if choosing to click the card in your hand, rather than typing the name.
[The Great Aurora] does not function correctly.
[Ignite Memories] and similar cards can cause a game restart if the target has no cards in hand.
[Hollow One] doesn’t count discarded split cards.
[Structural Collapse] does not cause target to sacrifice a land.
[Genju of the Fields] does not cause you to gain life upon dealing damage
If you manifest a creature with [Grafdigger's Cage] in play, it will be exiled.
[Containment Priest] exiles Theros Gods even when their devotion isn't met.
When controlling the Emblem of [Koth of the Hammer], lands do not display the blue text they have.
[Mirror Match] Non-creature permanents that become creatures temporarily are incorrectly considered blocked by the token copies
[Storage Matrix] Selecting yes to anything other than artifacts with two Storage Matrices in play causes the game to soft lock.
[Gideon's Intervention] Casting a second copy causes the first to become partially non-functional, allowing the named card to deal damage.
[Dream Halls] Ability is non-functional. Cannot cast spells with the alternative Casting Cost.
[Identity Thief] Restarts the game when attempting to copy a creature.
Non-land permanents that have become lands due to an enchantment, such as Imprisoned in the Moon, do not trigger the third ability of [The Gitrog Monster] when put into the graveyard
[Myriad Landscape] Ability incorrectly allows a player to put two basic lands that do not share a land type onto the battlefield.
[Vizier of Many Faces] If the Vizier copies a token creature that was created with embalm, the Vizier will display with no art.
[Combat Celebrant] does not allow you to exert it when attacking a planeswalker.
[Thornbow Archer] Incorrectly grants 1 life to opponents that do not control an Elf, rather than causing them to lose 1 life.
[Unscythe, Killer of Kings] Effect procs when creatures aren't equipped
[Island Sanctuary]'s replacement effect is available if you draw a card during an opponents draw step
[Spoils of Victory] The land comes into play tapped instead
[Semblance Anvil] imprinting a split card does not reduce costs on instants/sorceries.
[Athreos, God of Passage] does not associate its triggers with specific creatures.
[Riptide Replicator] token uses incorrect art.
[Custodi Lich] The sacrifice trigger happens whenever any player becomes the monarch.
[Curse of Shallow Graves] creates Zombie tokens with incorrect art.
[Synthetic Destiny][Mass Polymorph] does not take commanders into account when determining the number of creatures to reveal.
[Synthetic Destiny][Mass Polymorph] does not take commanders into account when determining the number of creatures to reveal.
[Reflecting Pool] does not get the ability to add any color of mana to your mana pool from Crumbling Vestige.
[Memory Lapse] moves aftermath cards back on top of the library instead of to the exile zone.
[Runic Repetition] Cannot be cast
[Tawnos's Coffin] crashes the game for everyone when it tries to return a card to the battlefield.
[Nebuchadnezzar] ability makes the game start endlessly repeating itself
[Primitive Justice] will either not cast/restart the game with a single target.
[Living Lore] If Living Lore imprints a Split Card, it has twice the expected CMC.
[Zur's Weirding] Reveals but doesn't allow you to pay
[Whims of the Fates] Causes client crashes
[Shifty Doppelganger] Restarts the game at end of turn
[Reincarnation] Does nothing
[Reap] puts a "face down ability" into hand instead of the targetted cards
[Profane Command] If a player gains shroud in response to Profane Command, the first mode will still resolve / choosing to give creatures fear when you control no creatures prompts a large number.
[Odds] Odds: Restarts the game in buggy state on heads
[Null Chamber]'s Controller is asked to name two non-basic lands, rather than each player naming a card that's not a basic land.
[Mana Bloom] Ability does not generate mana on opponents' turns.
[Lich] If you cannot sacrifice enough permanents, the game restarts
[Karplusan Minotaur] Cumulative upkeep cannot be paid
[Infinite Reflection] All creatures become copies, not just ones you control.
[High Seas] only affects red creature spells, rather than red or green creature spells.
[Harness the Storm] Doesn't trigger when casting split cards.
[Cryptic Gateway] Cannot select a card from your hand
[Concerted Effort] Specific protections are not shared among all creatures. (example Harbinger of Spring Protection from non-Spirit Creatures)
[Cloud Key] Players are unable to correctly select a card type
